com.hazelcast.map.impl.eviction

Class ExpirationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.map.impl.eviction.ExpirationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OperationResponseHandler

    public final class ExpirationManager
extends Object
implements OperationResponseHandler
    This class is responsible for gradual cleanup of expired entries. For this purpose it uses a background task.

    This background task can be accelerated or can be slowed down by using the system properties below:

    • "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.task.period.seconds": A new round is started after this period of seconds. Default value is 5 seconds. So every 5 seconds there will be a new round.
    • "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.cleanup.percentage": Scannable percentage of entries in a maps' partition in each round. Default percentage is 10%.
    • "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.cleanup.operation.count": Number of scannable partitions in each round. No default value exists. Dynamically calculated against partition-count or partition-thread-count.
    • "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.primary.drives_backup": Used to enable/disable management of backup expiration from primary. This can only be used with max idle seconds expiration.

    These parameters can be set node-wide or system-wide

    Node-wide setting example: 

              Config config = new Config();
          config.setProperty(
          "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.cleanup.operation.count", "3");
          Hazelcast.newHazelcastInstance(config);

    System-wide setting example: 

           System.setProperty(
       "hazelcast.internal.map.expiration.cleanup.operation.count", "3");

    Since:
    3.3
